reasoning: Sensorimotor neuropathy is a specific manifestation of peripheral nerve dysfunction affecting both motor and sensory fibers. Incidence ~5 per 100k per year estimated from diabetic cohort studies (primary etiology). Prevalence ~18% of at-risk populations (200+ million globally), but variable due to multiple etiologies (diabetes, chemotherapy, infections, toxins). Confidence moderate due to heterogeneous causes and limited population-based epidemiology.
source: Tesfaye S et al. (2005). Vascular risk factors and diabetic neuropathy. N Engl J Med. 352:341-350
